quest.name: Lathe to the Party
journal:
 Quest Sync
Sezul has another request that requires a featherless one's touch.

With the construction of a new lathe in mind, Sezul has tasked you with obtaining a high-grade gearwheel. Speak with your fellow featherless one, Tataramu, and see if he has any ideas on where to begin your search.

※Please note that the difficulty of this quest has been synced to your current level.

While discussing the subject of lathes, Tataramu recalls that just such a tool was used in his grandfather's workshop years ago. The eager designer reasons that Colson, a veteran Skyways employee, would know better than any what became of his grandsire's tools. Head to the Carline Canopy in Gridania, and track down Tataramu's aged acquaintance.

After explaining your predicament to Colson, the old man casts his mind back to the days when he first worked with Tataramu's grandfather. Though the company founder's original workshop has long since been dismantled, Colson suggests that you approach one of the old hands at the Bobbing Cork and ask if anything remains of Tatanora's tools. Travel to Fallgourd Float, and speak with Aeluuin.

You question Aeluuin about the lathe, but the inn worker appears unaware that such a workshop ever existed in Fallgourd. He does, however, mention a pile of old, unclaimed goods that have been gathering dust in the inn's storeroom. Search through the stack of antiques by the side of the Bobbing Cork, and check for any abandoned lathe parts.

Tataramu appears just as you locate the lathe gearwheel, having finally remembered where his grandfather's workshop used to be. Checking over the precious part, the young man notices a dedication written by his grandfather inscribed on its surface. Return to Ehcatl and hand the gearwheel to Sezul.

You deliver the gearwheel to Sezul, and the Ehcatl Nine chief confirms that the “Dezul Qualan” in the dedication is the same Ixal for whom he named the hybrid airship. It would appear that Sezul's mentor and Tataramu's grandsire had forged a friendship based on their mutual passion for aeronautics. Both Chief Totoloc and Tataramu cannot help but feel the guiding hand of fate in their growing partnership...
objectives: Speak with Aeluuin at the Bobbing Cork.
Deliver the lathe gearwheel to Sezul Totoloc.

dialogue.name: SEZULTOTOLOC
dialogue.text: Squawk! Have need of Forename's help, Sezul does!

dialogue.name: SEZULTOTOLOC
dialogue.text: So close! So close, we are! Taking shape before our very eyes, Dezul Qualan is!

dialogue.name: SEZULTOTOLOC
dialogue.text: Hull for body. Engine for heart. Next, fashion muscle to transfer power to wings, we must!

dialogue.name: SEZULTOTOLOC
dialogue.text: Developed by featherless ones, ceruleum technology was. Very advanced! First Ixal in history to design and build our own engine, we are!

dialogue.name: SEZULTOTOLOC
dialogue.text: Function perfectly, main engine components do. Flawless was Tataramu's design! And abundance of materials for upcoming task, we have.

dialogue.name: SEZULTOTOLOC
dialogue.text: But tiny problem, there is! ...Maybe not so tiny! Squawk!

dialogue.name: SEZULTOTOLOC
dialogue.text: Machine tool for cutting transmission parts, we have not!

dialogue.name: SEZULTOTOLOC
dialogue.text: Many intricate gears and cogs harness power produced by engine. Propel propulsion system, they do!

dialogue.name: SEZULTOTOLOC
dialogue.text: With one precision gearwheel...then make lathe to grind such parts, we could.

dialogue.name: SEZULTOTOLOC
dialogue.text: Our best hope, Forename is! Beg! Borrow! Steal! But have that gearwheel, we must!

dialogue.name: SEZULTOTOLOC
dialogue.text: Only featherless ones have item we seek! Rest on Forename's shoulders, fate of Dezul Qualan does!

dialogue.name: SEZULTOTOLOC
dialogue.text: Make new lathe, we must! With precision gearwheel, then craft intricate transmission parts, we can!

dialogue.name: TATARAMU
dialogue.text: I was listening in on Sezul's lamentations. 'Twould seem we are in need of a new lathe...or failing that, a part that will allow us to build one.

dialogue.name: TATARAMU
dialogue.text: A gearwheel such as the one we seek must be of the highest degree of workmanship─should it be warped by even the smallest fraction, that imperfection will be reflected in the turning of the lathe and make the crafting of precision components impossible.

dialogue.name: TATARAMU
dialogue.text: No, it must be one made to extremely exacting specifications. I speak of the difference of a single hair's width here.

dialogue.name: TATARAMU
dialogue.text: In the entire realm of Eorzea, I could count on the fingers of one hand the master artisans who are capable of forging such a piece.

dialogue.name: TATARAMU
dialogue.text: And even should we be so fortunate as to secure the services of such a talented individual, we must consider the time it would take to craft the gearwheel... Our project might languish for weeks, if not months!

dialogue.name: TATARAMU
dialogue.text: 'Twould be far better were we to focus on obtaining an existing gearwheel. ...And then somehow convincing the owner to part with it. Hmmm...

dialogue.name: TATARAMU
dialogue.text: A lathe, a lathe... Now where have I seen a lathe before? ...Ah, yes, I have vague memories of seeing one in my grandfather's workshop. Which was...somewhere outside the city.

dialogue.name: TATARAMU
dialogue.text: Forename, that's it! You must return to Gridania and speak with Colson once more.

dialogue.name: TATARAMU
dialogue.text: He's been with Highwind Skyways since the beginning. If anyone were to know what's become of my grandfather's lathe, 'twould be Colson!

dialogue.name: TATARAMU
dialogue.text: He will likely be in or around the Carline Canopy─the old man is never far from the airships when not attending to business!

dialogue.name: TATARAMU
dialogue.text: Colson is an old hand at my father's company, and was well acquainted with my grandsire. He may remember what became of the tools from Grandfather's workshop...not to mention where the workshop actually was.

dialogue.name: COLSON
dialogue.text: Yes, yes, I remember you─my eyesight may be failing, but my mind is yet sharp, thank you very much. You're the lasslad Master Tataramu employed as his delivery girlboy. Surely the materials I provided you with were sufficient, yes?

dialogue.name: COLSON
dialogue.text: Hm? The young master wishes to know what became of the lathe from his grandfather's workshop? Well now, that does bring back memories.

dialogue.name: COLSON
dialogue.text: It must be nigh on fifty years ago now that I began my apprenticeship with Tatanora, a famous adventurer and businessman.

dialogue.name: COLSON
dialogue.text: I still recall the day he conceived his revolutionary enterprise: he proposed the idea of building passenger balloons that shared the principle─if not the purpose─of Ixali dirigibles.

dialogue.name: COLSON
dialogue.text: His company was the very first air travel service in the realm, and marked the birth of Highwind Skyways.

dialogue.name: COLSON
dialogue.text: Of course, it was not until around thirty years later, when Cid Garlond brought airship technology to Eorzea, that flights between cities became a regular occurrence.

dialogue.name: COLSON
dialogue.text: Those were the days, though... If I close my eyes I can still see the workshop─can still hear our excited optimism as Tatanora and I worked tirelessly on the construction of that first balloon...

dialogue.name: COLSON
dialogue.text: Ahem. Pray excuse an old man his reminiscing. What were we speaking of? Ah yes, “lathes.”

dialogue.name: COLSON
dialogue.text: I believe the lathe Master Tataramu refers to was the one we used in the old Fallgourd workshop.

dialogue.name: COLSON
dialogue.text: ...But I'm afraid the place was shut down and dismantled for lumber after Tatabaru assumed management of the company. It was the end of an era, after all.

dialogue.name: COLSON
dialogue.text: I wonder if there are any still in Fallgourd who remember that time... Perhaps you might try speaking with the employees of the Bobbing Cork?

dialogue.name: COLSON
dialogue.text: “Spread your wings and soar”... That is the Skyways slogan. When I first heard Tatanora utter that phrase, I knew at that moment what my life's work would be.

dialogue.name: COLSON
dialogue.text: All that I am now began in that workshop─shaped by my craft even as I shaped wood and metal. I find myself hoping the lathe you seek has somehow survived...

dialogue.name: AELUUIN
dialogue.text: Welcome to the Bobbing Cork, friend. Will you be needing a room? ...No? You've come for a drink and some gossip, then?

dialogue.name: AELUUIN
dialogue.text: ...A “lathe”? I'm afraid I'm unfamiliar with the term. Some manner of tool from the old Skyways workshop that used to stand here in Fallgourd?

dialogue.name: AELUUIN
dialogue.text: A pity our previous owner has moved on─ten years I've worked here, but never have I heard talk of any such workshop.

dialogue.name: AELUUIN
dialogue.text: Hmmm. Well, I may know naught of any lathe, but we do have a mountain of unclaimed possessions that we've been adding to since the dawn of bloody time.

dialogue.name: AELUUIN
dialogue.text: The inn has the largest storeroom in town, you see, and it's the favored reliquary for all manner of unwanted or forgotten artifacts that once belonged to either residents or customers.

dialogue.name: AELUUIN
dialogue.text: Only just this morning I thought to clear some space by throwing away the oldest and dustiest relics. You're more than welcome to sift through the pile outside and take whatever you wish.

dialogue.name: AELUUIN
dialogue.text: You'll find a pile of unclaimed goods outside by the side of the inn. I hope the gods smile upon you and you find what you seek.

dialogue.name: TATARAMU
dialogue.text: Forename! Is that what I think it is...?

dialogue.name: TATARAMU
dialogue.text: The gearwheel from the lathe! I came to Fallgourd on the barest of remembrances, but I'm certainly glad I did!

dialogue.name: TATARAMU
dialogue.text: The workshop itself is gone, but some things are too precious to simply fling onto a midden heap. One of the artisans must have saved it.

dialogue.name: TATARAMU
dialogue.text: My grandfather was always well respected, you see, and even in his later years he would take me to see the workers practicing their trade.

dialogue.name: TATARAMU
dialogue.text: “Listen well, Tataramu,” he would say. “Coin has its uses, but aught of true value is bought with passion and persistence! To reach the highest skies, you must spread your wings and soar!”

dialogue.name: TATARAMU
dialogue.text: His words of wisdom were as the sweetest lullabies to me as a child. 'Twas likely his influence that encouraged me to pursue my love of airship design.

dialogue.name: TATARAMU
dialogue.text: ...Hm? What's this? The face of the gearwheel is engraved with a dedication of some kind.

dialogue.name: TATARAMU
dialogue.text:
For my dear friend, Dezul Qualan.
On these wings I pledge our everlasting bond.

Tatanora

dialogue.name: TATARAMU
dialogue.text: ...B-But this would mean...

dialogue.name: TATARAMU
dialogue.text: Forename! Let us return to Ehcatl and deliver this treasure to Sezul without delay. There are certain questions to which our Ixal colleague may hold the answers...

dialogue.name: SEZULTOTOLOC
dialogue.text: Squawk! Nervously waiting for Forename's return, Sezul was! Releasing decidedly unblessed wind, bowels were!

dialogue.name: SEZULTOTOLOC
dialogue.text: Caw, caw, caw! Yes! Exactly what we need, this gearwheel is!

dialogue.name: SEZULTOTOLOC
dialogue.text: Good. Good, good, good! Edging much closer to reality, dream of Dezul Qualan is!

dialogue.name: TATARAMU
dialogue.text: Sezul, there is something I would ask you.

dialogue.name: SEZULTOTOLOC
dialogue.text: Pale, Tataramu looks. Nervous belly like Sezul? Ask permission to use latrine trench, Tataramu need not!

dialogue.name: TATARAMU
dialogue.text: Ah, no, I─ Perhaps you should just read the inscription on the gearwheel.

dialogue.name: SEZULTOTOLOC
dialogue.text: Hm? Inscription? Ah, see tiny words, Sezul did not!

dialogue.name: SEZULTOTOLOC
dialogue.text:
For my dear friend, Dezul Qualan.
On these wings I pledge our everlasting bond.

Tatanora

dialogue.name: TATARAMU
dialogue.text: “Tatanora” is my grandsire. He is the man who founded Highwind Skyways, forty-six years ago. And I'm fairly certain we've all heard that second name before...

dialogue.name: SEZULTOTOLOC
dialogue.text: ...Caw, caw! Caw, caw, caw! Squaaawk!

dialogue.name: TATARAMU
dialogue.text: Care to share the source of your amusement, Sezul?

dialogue.name: SEZULTOTOLOC
dialogue.text: Too perfect, it is! Destined to fall into our hands, this gearwheel was!

dialogue.name: SEZULTOTOLOC
dialogue.text: Dezul Qualan... Outcast and genius! First chief of Ehcatl Nine! Master balloon maker...and Sezul's respected mentor!

dialogue.name: TATARAMU
dialogue.text: Your mentor!? Then, the name of our hybrid airship...?

dialogue.name: SEZULTOTOLOC
dialogue.text: Yes! One and same! Think of better way to honor chief's memory, Sezul could not!

dialogue.name: TATARAMU
dialogue.text: ...Then it was true.

dialogue.name: SEZULTOTOLOC
dialogue.text: Squawk...?

dialogue.name: TATARAMU
dialogue.text: I speak of an old rumor. 'Twas said that Grandfather's company was built on his “appropriation” of beastman aeronautics─that all the balloons he flew were naught more than base imitations of Ixali-made vessels.

dialogue.name: TATARAMU
dialogue.text:
'Tis a rumor that was officially denied. And any mention has been thoroughly expunged from written records on the assertion that even unfounded claims of stolen beastman technology would unduly harm Highwind Skyways' reputation.
I had thought it merely the rumblings of rivals, sick with envy at Grandfather's success.

dialogue.name: SEZULTOTOLOC
dialogue.text: Yes! Envy, it was! Squawk! Envy that led your ancestors to steal our genius! Thieves! Thieves and liars!

dialogue.name: TATARAMU
dialogue.text: Sezul, I...

dialogue.name: SEZULTOTOLOC
dialogue.text: Caw, caw, caw! Pulling Tataramu's tailfeathers, Sezul was! Judging by words on gearwheel... Stolen from us, this knowledge was not.

dialogue.name: SEZULTOTOLOC
dialogue.text: Friends, they were! Shared craft with Tataramu's grandfather, Dezul Qualan did.

dialogue.name: SEZULTOTOLOC
dialogue.text: See it clearly, Sezul can. Two dreamers gazing into vast sky, one feathered and one not. Not so different are past and present, eh?

dialogue.name: TATARAMU
dialogue.text: Fate has had a hand in our meeting, it would seem. I am honored to continue the friendship our elders began, Sezul Totoloc.

dialogue.name: SEZULTOTOLOC
dialogue.text: <sniff> Squawk! Dust in Sezul's eye, there is! Back to work! Swiftly now, or find tongue shortened on new lathe, Tataramu will!

dialogue.name: TATARAMU
dialogue.text: The friend Grandfather names on that gearwheel... Surely it cannot be coincidence...?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Thanks to your diligent efforts, Sezul's crew can now use their new lathe to craft the gears and cogs that will transfer power from the engine to the wings! Continue assisting the Ehcatl Nine to see the airship hybrid reach completion.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have achieved Trusted reputation with the Ehcatl Nine.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: New Ixal tribal daily quests are now available from Tazel Meyean the Lettered at Ehcatl.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
